poem:
Title: "The Aching of Bethlehem"

In Gaza's crumbled echo, lies
the mirth of power, too grand.
Israel's hand, by Hamas scarred,
grasps at peace's fickle sand.

Van Hollen speaks - words spear the wind,
but fall on deafened ground.
Two senators devoid of home,
in conflict's dance, are found.

Supply lines weave a bitter route,
through checkpoint's stony smile.
In this so-called deconfliction,
we lose our soul awhile.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Middle East crisis live: Israel says it has completed mission to destroy Hamas infrastructure in northern Gaza 6.00pm GMT In a new interview with CBS, US senator Chris Van Hollen, a Democrat from Maryland spoke of the “the unnecessarily cumbersome process going through the Israeli screening process” of supplies, and “the so-called deconfliction process.” Van Hollen, who recently visited the Rafah border crossing with US Democratic senator Jeff Merkeley of Oregon, said: “There are two". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
